intro: Zornia songeensis, commonly known as the Songe's zornia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates. It is often found in woodland areas and along stream banks, where it contributes to local biodiversity. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare species in its native habitat.
